scenes.title: The Prize
scenes.narration_text:
Mr Raven was perched upon a limb,
And Reynard the Fox looked up at him;
For the Raven held in his great big beak,
A morsel the Fox would go far to seek.
scenes.visual_prompt: A forest setting. Mr. Raven is perched high on a tree limb. He holds a large, delicious morsel (cheese or meat) in his beak. Reynard the Fox looks up at him from below.

scenes.title: The Flattery Begins
scenes.narration_text:
Said the Fox, in admiring tones: 'My word!
Sir Raven, you are a handsome bird.
scenes.visual_prompt: Reynard the Fox speaks up to the Raven with a charming smile, gesturing admiringly.

scenes.title: The Temptation
scenes.narration_text:
Such feathers! If you would only sing,
The birds of these woods would call you King.'
scenes.visual_prompt: The Fox continues to flatter. The Raven looks down, puffing up his chest, looking pleased.

scenes.title: The Foolish Pride
scenes.narration_text:
The Raven, who did not see the joke,
Forgot that his voice was just a croak.
scenes.visual_prompt: The Raven swells with pride, preparing to sing. He looks very self-important.

scenes.title: The Fall
scenes.narration_text:
He opened his beak, in his foolish pride-
And down fell the morsel the Fox had eyed.
scenes.visual_prompt: The Raven opens his beak wide to 'sing'. The morsel falls out of his beak towards the ground.

scenes.title: The Lesson
scenes.narration_text:
'Ha-ha!' laughed the Fox. 'And now you know,
Ignore sweet words that make you glow.
scenes.visual_prompt: The Fox laughs, having caught the morsel. He looks up at the Raven with a sly grin.

scenes.title: The Moral
scenes.narration_text:
Pride, my friend, is rather unwise;
I'm sure this teaching is quite a surprise
scenes.visual_prompt: The Fox trots away with his prize. The Raven looks down from the branch, looking sad and foolish.
